summary_gpt: Tata Motors Limited has approved the issuance of up to ₹500 crore in Non-Convertible Debentures (NCDs) through private placement, with details of the tranche structure, tenure, and listing on NSE disclosed. The NCDs are rated, unsecured, fixed coupon, and proposed to be listed on the Wholesale Debt Market segment of NSE.

Tata Motors Limited has approved the issuance of up to ₹500 crore in Non-Convertible Debentures (NCDs) through private placement, with details of the tranche structure, tenure, and listing on NSE disclosed. The NCDs are rated, unsecured, fixed coupon, and scheduled for allotment in May 2025, maturing in 2028.

Tata Motors reported a 6.2% decline in total sales for April 2025, with domestic sales decreasing by 7% and overall units sold dropping from 77,521 to 72,753. The sales decline was observed across both commercial vehicles and passenger vehicles, with notable reductions in certain segments like SCV cargo and pickup trucks.

Tata Motors Limited has scheduled a board meeting on May 2, 2025, to consider issuing up to ₹500 crore of rated, listed, unsecured, redeemable, non-convertible debentures via private placement. This indicates a potential move to raise debt capital for future growth or refinancing.

Tata Motors announced a scheduled conference call on May 13, 2025, to discuss its Q4 FY25 financial results, involving senior management from Tata Motors and Jaguar Land Rover. The event aims to provide insights into the company's quarterly performance and future outlook.
